decks.notes: This Modern Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying a strong board presence of artifact creatures, supported by cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer. By using artifact lands like Blinkmoth Nexus and Inkmoth Nexus, along with Mox Opal for ramp, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and equipment like Cranial Plating. With a mix of evasion and protection options, the deck's key strategy is to quickly build a threatening board state and push for a fast victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures onto the battlefield and using effects like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump them up and deal damage to the opponent. The combination of cheap creatures like Ornithopter and Vault Skirge with powerful artifacts like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager allows for explosive starts and aggressive plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast clock and efficient threats while protecting its key pieces with cards like Spellskite and Etched Champion. With a focus on synergy and efficient mana usage, this deck aims to win the game quickly through combat damage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of cheap artifacts and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Cranial Plating, the deck can create a fast clock and put pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Spellskite and Etched Champion provide protection for key threats, while cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum help to ramp out threats faster. The deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with elves to generate large amounts of mana, allowing for explosive plays and combos. By utilizing cards like Devoted Druid, Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, and Elvish Archdruid, the deck can quickly generate mana for powerful plays such as casting Wurmcoil Engine or using Ezuri, Renegade Leader's abilities to overwhelm opponents. Additionally, cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company provide flexibility and the ability to tutor for important combo pieces. The synergy between the elves and mana generation is key to the deck's success.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while utilizing card advantage and efficient removal spells to gain control of the game. Utilizing powerful instant speed spells like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage, along with efficient threats like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, this deck aims to grind out victories by outmaneuvering the opponent and playing a versatile game plan.

The strategy of this Grixis Control deck is centered around disruption and removal spells to control the opponent's board while also leveraging card advantage and graveyard recursion with Snapcaster Mage and delve creatures like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler. The deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check using counterspells, removal, and card draw, ultimately grinding out a win through attrition. The mana base is optimized for casting spells in all three colors of Grixis, allowing for flexibility in playing a wide range of powerful spells.

This Jund deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing efficient removal spells and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to quickly control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has access to versatile planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and utility creatures like Scavenging Ooze to further control the battlefield and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to end the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive threats and disruption spells.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on disruption and efficient threats to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Fulminator Mage provide additional disruption by destroying the opponent's lands. Overall, this deck aims to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying constant pressure to secure the win.

A deck that focuses on playing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, backed up by disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Path to Exile. The deck also includes removal spells like Maelstrom Pulse and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. Liliana of the Veil helps control the board and disrupts the opponent's plans. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements, with a mix of fetch lands and utility lands. The goal of the deck is to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with Lord of Atlantis and other tribal lords, while disrupting opponent's game plan with counterspells like Cursecatcher and removal spells like Dismember and Vapor Snag. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, and Spreading Seas to disrupt opponent's mana base. Master of Waves and Master of the Pearl Trident provide additional power and resilience to the tribe, while Thassa, God of the Sea and Kira, Great Glass-Spinner offer protection and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize creatures with powerful abilities to create and execute combos. By using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the deck can search for and put into play key pieces such as Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit, Melira, Sylvok Outcast, and Blood Artist. The Creatures Toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility in finding solutions to various board states, with cards like Scavenging Ooze, Viscera Seer, and Orzhov Pontiff providing utility and interaction. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistency in mana production.

This deck revolves around creating a combo with cards like Splinter Twin, Deceiver Exarch, and Pestermite to create infinite token creatures. The goal is to control the game with counterspells and removal until you can assemble this combo and overwhelm your opponent with an unending stream of creatures. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage for recursion and card advantage, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt to help deal with threats. The key strategy is to efficiently and patiently set up the combo while disrupting your opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggressive plays with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. It also includes powerful control elements such as Snapcaster Mage, Spell Snare, and Mana Leak to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent with early threats while utilizing disruption spells to protect its own board and maintain tempo. Additionally, it includes card draw and selection spells like Serum Visions and Thought Scour to ensure consistency and keep the opponent on the back foot.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, while also maintaining a strong board presence with threats like Geist of Saint Traft and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck also includes versatile spells like Remand and Spell Snare to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support all three colors - white, blue, and red - allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent in the mid to late game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and powerful creatures in the early game, while using removal spells to clear the way. The deck focuses on aggressive plays and utilizing mana dorks like Noble Hierarch to ramp into threats like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary. With a mix of beatdown creatures, removal, and ways to generate card advantage like Collected Company, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent quickly.
